text: Ruth and Boaz was a great movie. Tyler and Serayah did a great job with the acting. I really enjoyed the soundtrack as well. I would love to see a part two. I would definitely recommend this movie.
The plot is right out of the Bible’s story of Ruth and has religious messages. I guess with all the bad news about our country’s demise I needed a romance with a positive ending.
It was a cute movie but the love story is rushed. There wasn’t enough there for me to truly root for the characters.
Very sweet! I would watch it again.

Ruth & Boaz is a great movie that delivers as intended.  It will have your emotions go from holding back tears, to talking to the screen and then the warmth of the sweetness of love.  Great job cast and crew.

I found the story line somewhat interesting, however, it was very cookie cutter.  The was the good person who made some bad choices and when that person wanted to change found that they were actually indebted to some evil sources. So, a typical run away from bad to a better lace thinking the past was behind but only to find the past locate her and come to claim what was thought to be his.  Confrontation between the good guy and bad guy…..etc.  This is what made the movie rather boring.  Good actors and pleasing scenery does not a solid movie make.  It reminded me of a Hallmark movie and I think that says enough.

I thought the movie was great.  There are too many critical movie watchers out there.  Lighten up.  Sure, some creative liberty was taken but the gist of the story of Ruth & Boaz comes across.  It's somewhat difficult to take an experience that is over 2000 years old from a completely different culture and modernize it without completely losing the relevance of the story.  I think the writers and actors did an amazing job bringing a modern look at a historical story.

The main characters did an awesome job.

Very casual acting. No stakes or real conflict from Ruth or Boaz. I couldn’t tell if Ruth liked Boaz and couldn’t tell if Boaz really liked her either. The dialog was weak and didn’t deal with the issues in a real human experience way. The relationships were not shown strong. No chemistry between Ruth and Boaz. It felt like a boundary was up from both sides. This is why as a viewer I felt nothing. Sure they all looked great. But that does nothing for my heart strings. It felt forced and rushed all the way through. I didn’t feel like Ruth was in a real commitment to her boyfriend in the beginning or cared for Naomi. The way the screenwriter presented their relationship, didn’t tell it. I was confused why Ruth went with Naomi because they didnt appear close enough for her to just go with her and let alone it didn’t show at all that she wanted to care for her. The writer presented it like she just want to get out a bad music deal. It seem like producers were more focused on the looks of the actors to tell a visually pretty love story.
